ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 51
ygData.msgSnippet: Well i finally got both halfs of page 30 to research my berserker spell. Researched it and walla i succeeded. Only to find out that it does not do what the
ygData.messageBody:
Well i finally got both halfs of page 30 to research my berserker spell. Researched it and walla i succeeded. Only to find out that it does not do what the book and all the web pages say wich is add STR and AGI. Instead it gives me 20 STR and takes away 10 Agility ?? What the hells up with that a buff that takes away something. I've made several different warrior classes experimenting with the different
stats and #1 althought STR does help i find it far less importent than dex or agility, I'de never trade 20 str for -10 agility. #2 its not even a trade off of 20 STR for -10 AGI ....Instead i can just use lvl 1 STR spell add 10 STR to whoever now the only difference between that and this new big bad Berserker STR spell is 10 STR and loosing 10 agility !!! What kinda damn spell is that...

> Message: 1
> Date: Wed, 19 May 1999 14:47:43 -0700
> From: osmosis <osmosis@...>
> Subject: Re: Enchanter Nerf Protest.
>
> At 04:11 PM 5/19/99 -0500, you wrote:
> >From: "Hapke, Matthew" <mahapke@...>
> >
> >Verant Guy #1: Hmm, sure is quiet in here.
> >Verant Guy #2: Yeah, all the enchanters are protesting by not playing.
> >Verant Guy #1: Really? We'll have to thank them later. Look! The
> >feedback list is cut in half today. You sure this isnt' a holiday?
>
> Exactly. This is the opposite of what we need to do, although I could be
> wrong. It seems as though they are working through improving the classes
> by way of taking the most used classes first and saving the least used ones
> last. Think of how many /petitions they would get if the major Wizard bomb
> spell wasnt working! Or if Spirit of the Wind suddenly worked like Fear.
> Give them time... I think the thing we must remember is BALANCE... they
> must BALANCE the classes, and I'm sure they are aware of this and know what
> they're doing. Hell, they MADE the game... i'm sure they will FIX it
>
> _______________________________________________________________________________
> _______________________________________________________________________________
>

> sand giant it would ahve resisted it (being red to you) and stomped youa s
> well as the rest.
>
> >Mesmerize does the same for me. I use it all the time on wisps in Erud's

> >> blues, totally. Risky or dangerous, doesn't seem to matter.
> >>
> >> Memory Blur is what I would deem a get out of Jail free card. It is a

> >> It stops them in their tracks, and makes em forget. It doesn't freeze

> Message: 6
> Date: Wed, 19 May 1999 18:32:11 EDT
> From: "Core Leader" <coreleader@...>
> Subject: Re: My 2 cents on the status of EQ
>
> Switching characters between servers is the stupidest idea anyone ever
> thought of... how are you ever going to be able to contact friends you made
> on one server? Of course YOU live near all your friends and can call them up
> saying let's all go to this server but everyone doesn't have that option...
> DO THEY? Think about it from a programming point of view, the transfering of
> characters would leave many many loopholes and whereas a program similar to
> uoextreme could jump in and give you 1000000 platium... hmm... You didn't
> think things through did you? Okay, you still don't agree so here goes some
> more... A new server comes up and everyone playing it is a newbie then all
> the sudden verant let's us do this stupid server switching crap and
> blacksmiths go over there selling everything at 5 times the cost they could
> get on an established server. This would also let high level parties go to a
> new server and camp all the huge monsters... Emporer Crush for example?
> Let's look a bit deeper... How would a guild be able to keep in contact?
> Talking between servers would cause ungodly 24 hour 7 days a week 365 days a
> year LAG!!!!! Not to mention the constant character switching would cause
> more lag therefore screwing up your playing anyways... So basically pick
> your server and STICK TO IT!!!! Why are people always wanting to move? When
> I first started playing I picked the server with the least amouth of people
> on it... Bertoxx, and it still remains towards the bottom of the server list
> and even if it had 2000 people playing all the time I would not switch
> because all my friends on that server... so thank you and sorry if it
> sounded like a flame because it was suppose to sound worse than that.
>
> _______________________________________________________________
> Get Free Email and Do More On The Web. Visit http://www.msn.com
>
> _______________________________________________________________________________
> _______________________________________________________________________________
>

> Message: 12
> Date: Wed, 19 May 1999 16:57:40 -0700
> From: "DeGirolami, Franck" <degirolami@...>
> Subject: Re: Enchanter Nerf Protest.
>
> Ok I've read a lot of things about protesting for the Enchanter's
> cause...lots of ideas on how to protest but shouldn't we come up with a list
> of balance issues that we can send to Verant.
> The main issue seems to be the resistibility of our spells. Here is what I
> think. All our spells are tested against Magic Resistance where other
> classes spells are tested against Fire or Cold Resistance. If you are in
> Lavastorm Mountain, all your fire based spell wont even harm a green
> creature. So the trade off is that our spells can affect creatures of any
> kind. The problem is that most of the magic-users get an extremely good MR
> due to spells. Another problem is the fact that our damage spells dont do
> any damage when resisted. Right now, our spells are almost never resisted by
> greens, rarely by blues, rarely by whites ( although I could not cast a
> single spell on Dorn when he was white to me ), sometimes resisted by
> yellows, resisted 20-30% of the time by the reds that are one level above
> yellows and resisted 100% by all other reds.
> Here is my list of suggestions:
> 1) Damage spells should at least do some damage when resisted following
> similar rules as the wizard spells with a lesser ratio maybe to keep a
> balance with those easy-to-kill wizards,
> 2) Our spells should not jump from a 20-30% resistance to a full 100%
> resistance, there should be a nicer ramp so that an enchanter is not
> completely useless in a group of 6 people attacking one strong red target.
>
> I dont have other suggestions because I personnaly think that enchanter is a
> very strong class. I have an enchanter level 16 now and I had a necro level
> 16 before and my enchanter is almost as good in solo ( nothing can beat the

>
> my 2 centimes,
> Skara

> Date: Wed, 19 May 1999 20:51:52 -0400
> From: " Steve H." <greedox@...>
> Subject: Re: Enchanter Nerf Protest.
>
> This is the most well thought out post of this whole discussion.... What we
> need to do is do exactly this, get an intelligent, thought out list of
> 'complaints', send it to Verant, and some of the bigger EQ sites...
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: DeGirolami, Franck <degirolami@...>
> To: <eqenchanters@onelist.com>
> Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 7:57 PM
> Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Enchanter Nerf Protest.
>
> > From: "DeGirolami, Franck" <degirolami@...>
> >
> > Ok I've read a lot of things about protesting for the Enchanter's
> > cause...lots of ideas on how to protest but shouldn't we come up with a
> list
> > of balance issues that we can send to Verant.
> > The main issue seems to be the resistibility of our spells. Here is what I
> > think. All our spells are tested against Magic Resistance where other
> > classes spells are tested against Fire or Cold Resistance. If you are in
> > Lavastorm Mountain, all your fire based spell wont even harm a green
> > creature. So the trade off is that our spells can affect creatures of any
> > kind. The problem is that most of the magic-users get an extremely good MR
> > due to spells. Another problem is the fact that our damage spells dont do
> > any damage when resisted. Right now, our spells are almost never resisted
> by
> > greens, rarely by blues, rarely by whites ( although I could not cast a
> > single spell on Dorn when he was white to me ), sometimes resisted by
> > yellows, resisted 20-30% of the time by the reds that are one level above
> > yellows and resisted 100% by all other reds.
> > Here is my list of suggestions:
> > 1) Damage spells should at least do some damage when resisted following
> > similar rules as the wizard spells with a lesser ratio maybe to keep a
> > balance with those easy-to-kill wizards,
> > 2) Our spells should not jump from a 20-30% resistance to a full 100%
> > resistance, there should be a nicer ramp so that an enchanter is not
> > completely useless in a group of 6 people attacking one strong red target.
> >
> > I dont have other suggestions because I personnaly think that enchanter is
> a
> > very strong class. I have an enchanter level 16 now and I had a necro
> level
> > 16 before and my enchanter is almost as good in solo ( nothing can beat
> the
> > triple dots+feign death+let pet finish the critter combo of the necro ),
> and
> > much much better ( much more useful would be the word ) in groups. I am
> just
> > annoyed that sometimes I have to watch my friends kill reds for me while I
> > cant even cast a spell to help except buffs.
> >
> > my 2 centimes,
> > Skara
